title: Best Mutual Funds: Apple, Microsoft, Facebook Lead Big Bets On Coronavirus Stock Market Rebound
summary:
As the coronavirus stock market tries to rebound, the list of stocks seeing large investments from the best mutual funds continues to grow.
Microsoft stock led the list, with the best mutual funds scooping up over $3 billion worth of shares in the latest report.
Up next were billion-dollar bets in Apple stock ($2.5 billion), PayPal stock ($1.4 billion), Eli Lilly stock ($1.4 billion), Netflix stock ($1.3 billion) and Alphabet stock ($1.3 billion).

text:
As the coronavirus stock market tries to rebound, the list of stocks seeing large investments from the best mutual funds continues to grow. Microsoft (MSFT), Apple (AAPL), PayPal (PYPL) and Netflix (NFLX) each received over $1 billion over the last three months from the best mutual funds.

X

Eli Lilly (LLY) and FANG stocks Facebook (FB) and Alphabet (GOOGL) also made the cut.

Microsoft stock led the list, with the best mutual funds scooping up over $3 billion worth of shares in the latest report. Up next were billion-dollar bets in Apple stock ($2.5 billion), PayPal stock ($1.4 billion), Eli Lilly stock ($1.4 billion), Netflix stock ($1.3 billion) and Alphabet stock ($1.3 billion).

In a sign of the strengthening coronavirus stock market recovery, these leading stocks to watch have been remarkably resilient. Microsoft, Apple, Netflix, Alphabet, PayPal and Eli Lilly have all been setting up, breaking past new buy points, or clearing recent buy zones.

Note: Be sure to check these Excel files to see all the stocks on the latest list of new buys and list of new sells by the best mutual funds.

Best Stocks To Buy And Watch In Coronavirus Stock Market

Companies like streaming pioneer Netflix and Zoom Video Communications (ZM) are on the list and certainly qualify as top stocks to watch as they benefit from social distancing and work-from-home trends in the coronavirus stock market. But they're by no means alone.

Here's an overview of some the best stocks to buy and watch as we look for the next crop of stock market winners to emerge.

Apple Stock

Apple broke out of a cup with handle at the end of April. The tech giant recovered from a sell-off that began in October 2018 and is now back near a new all-time high, with its relative strength line in new high ground. Apple topped analyst estimates for its March quarter when it reported on April 30.

Microsoft Stock

The cloud computing and software leader has rebounded from a sharp sell-off in tandem with the coronavirus crash. Microsoft stock has now cleared a 180.10 buy point, putting it just below a new all-time high. In a sign of market leadership, its relative strength is floating around a new high.

PayPal Stock

The peer-to-peer and online payments pioneer bolted higher Thursday after reporting earnings. PayPal stock is now extended past a 124.55 buy point. The Silicon Valley-based company was recently featured on the IBD Breakout Stocks Index.

Netflix Stock

The big shift to shutting down movie theaters has helped spur interest in at-home streaming services from Netflix and others. Netflix stock has benefited from that, with it now trading just below a new all-time high. In the last two quarters, the company has generated triple-digit earnings growth, including a 107% rise in Q1.

Facebook Stock

The social media giant is trying to close in on a 224.30 buy point. A breakout would lift Facebook stock to an all-time high. The company reported Q1 earnings on April 29, posting a 101% gain. Sales growth for the quarter slipped from 25% to 18%. To help customers cope with the Covid-19 pandemic, Facebook is working to enhance real-time video experiences and live game-streaming.

More Breakouts And Setups In Coronavirus Stock Market

A strengthening stock market rebound and the release of Q1 earnings has the potential to push several leading stocks to new heights.

ServiceNow (NOW), which has been featured on IBD Long-Term Leaders and several other lists, broke out on May 5, just after reporting 57% EPS and 33% quarterly sales growth. In the latest list of new buys by the best mutual funds, 24 leading money managers invested $574 million in ServiceNow stock.

Nvidia (NVDA) is also among top stocks to watch. After going through a steep correction that began in October 2018, the chip designer and leading AI stock is now testing a new all-time high. Nvidia is also on the latest list of new buys by the best funds, with 37 institutional investors picking up $875 million in shares.

So as the rebound from the coronavirus stock market crash tries to gather steam, keep a close eye on where the best mutual funds are placing their bets. And be sure to stay focused on the "three big rocks" of CAN SLIM investing to help ensure that you're placing your own bets on the top prospects.

Follow Matthew Galgani on Twitter at @IBD_MGalgani.

<li><a href="https://www.investors.com/category/etfs-and-funds/mutual-funds/" rel="category tag">Mutual Funds</a></li></ul> <h1 class="header1">
See Where Top Funds Are Betting Big On Coronavirus Stock Market Rebound	</h1>
<div class="featured-post-image-container"></div>
<div class="addtoany_share_save_container addtoany_content_top row">
<div class="share">
<div class="a2a_kit a2a_kit_size_25 addtoany_list" data-a2a-url="https://www.investors.com/etfs-and-funds/mutual-funds/best-mutual-funds-microsoft-apple-facebook-google-lead-stocks-to-buy-watch/" <ul class="post-meta">
<li><span class="authors-links"><a href="https://www.investors.com/author/galganim/" title="Posts by MATTHEW GALGANI" class="author url fn" rel="author">MATTHEW GALGANI</a></span></li>

<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p>As the <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/coronavirus-stock-market-crash-survival-guide/">coronavirus stock market</a> tries to rebound, the list of stocks seeing large investments from the best mutual funds continues to grow. <strong>Microsoft</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=MSFT' target='_blank'>MSFT</a>), <strong>Apple</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AAPL' target='_blank'>AAPL</a>), <strong>PayPal</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=PYPL' target='_blank'>PYPL</a>) and <strong>Netflix</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NFLX' target='_blank'>NFLX</a>) each received over $1 billion over the last three months from the best mutual funds.</p>
<span>
<span style="width:50%;" class="video-player-container vms-left">
<span class="shortcode-video" vid-id="5750190" vid-dom-id="5750190-5ebb5eb42f561" vid-top="false" vid-repeat="1" vid-width="50" vid-url="https://content.jwplatform.com/manifests/ZSMf2S8I.m3u8" data-captions="" vid-name="Find The Best Long-Term Investments With IBD Long-Term Leaders" vid-cat="Learn How To Trade Stocks Using Research Tools" vid-date="04/24/2020" vid-image="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/ZSMf2S8I-640x360.jpg" vid-authors="Matt Galgani">
<span class="close-mini-vid">X</span>
<span id="shortcode-video-player-5750190-5ebb5eb42f561" class="ready-to-load"></span>
</span>
</span>
</span><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Find The Best Long-Term Investments With IBD Long-Term Leaders","description":"Looking for stocks with solid earnings stablility and a proven track record of outperfomrance across multiple market cycles? Start with IBD Long-Term Leaders.","thumbnailUrl":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/04\/ZSMf2S8I-640x360.jpg","contentUrl":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/manifests\/ZSMf2S8I.m3u8","uploadDate":"2020-04-24T09:52:32+0000","duration":"PT69.59S","author":"Matt Galgani","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Investor's Business Daily","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ibd-logo.png"},"url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com"},"keywords":""}</script>
<p><strong>Eli Lilly</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=LLY' target='_blank'>LLY</a>) and <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/technology/fang-stocks-news-quotes-facebook-amazon-netflix-google/">FANG stocks</a> <strong>Facebook</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=FB' target='_blank'>FB</a>) and <strong>Alphabet</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=GOOGL' target='_blank'>GOOGL</a>) also made the cut.</p>
<p>Microsoft stock led the list, with the best mutual funds scooping up over $3 billion worth of shares in the latest report. Up next were billion-dollar bets in Apple stock ($2.5 billion), PayPal stock ($1.4 billion), Eli Lilly stock ($1.4 billion), Netflix stock ($1.3 billion) and Alphabet stock ($1.3 billion).</p>
<p>In a sign of the strengthening coronavirus stock market recovery, these leading <a href="https://www.investors.com/tag/coronavirus-stocks-to-watch/">stocks to watch</a> have been remarkably resilient. Microsoft, Apple, Netflix, Alphabet, PayPal and Eli Lilly have all been setting up, breaking past new buy points, or clearing recent buy zones.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/NewBuys_051120.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener">New Buys By The Best Mutual Funds</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/NewSells_051120.pdf">New Sells By The Best Mutual Funds</a></li>
</ul>
<h6><em>Note: Be sure to check these Excel files to see all the stocks on the latest <a href="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/2020_05_TopBuys.xlsx" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong><span style="color: blue;">list of new buys</span></strong></a> and <a href="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/2020_05_TopSells.xlsx" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span style="color: blue;"><strong>list of new sells</strong></span></a> by the best mutual funds.</em></h6>
<h2>Best Stocks To Buy And Watch In Coronavirus Stock Market</h2>
<p>Companies like streaming pioneer Netflix and <strong>Zoom Video Communications</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=ZM' target='_blank'>ZM</a>) are on the list and certainly qualify as top stocks to watch as they benefit from social distancing and work-from-home trends in the coronavirus stock market. But they're by no means alone.</p>
<p>Here's an overview of some the <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/best-stocks-to-buy-now/">best stocks to buy and watch</a> as we look for the next crop of <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/sp500-beating-lists-find-next-apple-amazon/">stock market winners</a> to emerge.</p>
<h2>Apple Stock</h2>
<p>Apple broke out of a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/chart-reading-for-beginners-chart-patterns-cup-with-handle-double-bottom-flat-base/">cup with handle</a> at the end of April. The tech giant recovered from a sell-off that began in October 2018 and is now back near a new all-time high, with its relative strength line in new high ground. <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/technology/click/apple-earnings-q2-2020-aapl-stock/">Apple topped analyst estimates</a> for its March quarter when it reported on April 30.</p>
<h2>Microsoft Stock</h2>
<p>The cloud computing and software leader has rebounded from a sharp sell-off in tandem with the coronavirus crash. Microsoft stock has now cleared a 180.10 buy point, putting it just below a new all-time high. In a sign of market leadership, its relative strength is floating around a new high.</p>
<h2>PayPal Stock</h2>
<p>The peer-to-peer and online payments pioneer bolted higher Thursday after reporting earnings. PayPal stock is now extended past a 124.55 buy point. The Silicon Valley-based company was recently featured on the <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/breakout-stocks-technical-analysis/paypal-stock-near-all-time-high-as-mastercard-visa-square-also-report-earnings/">IBD Breakout Stocks Index</a>.</p>
<h2>Netflix Stock</h2>
<p>The big shift to shutting down movie theaters has helped spur interest in at-home streaming services from Netflix and others. Netflix stock has benefited from that, with it now trading just below a new all-time high. In the last two quarters, the company has generated triple-digit earnings growth, including a 107% rise in Q1.</p>

<h2>Facebook Stock</h2>
<p>The social media giant is trying to close in on a 224.30 buy point. A breakout would lift Facebook stock to an all-time high. The company reported Q1 earnings on April 29, posting a 101% gain. Sales growth for the quarter slipped from 25% to 18%. To help customers cope with the Covid-19 pandemic, Facebook is working to enhance real-time video experiences and live game-streaming.</p>
<h2>More Breakouts And Setups In Coronavirus Stock Market</h2>
<p>A strengthening stock market rebound and the release of Q1 earnings has the potential to push several leading stocks to new heights.</p>
<p><strong>ServiceNow</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NOW' target='_blank'>NOW</a>), which has been featured on <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-long-term-leaders-screen/">IBD Long-Term Leaders</a> and several other lists, broke out on May 5, just after reporting 57% EPS and 33% quarterly sales growth. In the latest list of new buys by the best mutual funds, 24 leading money managers invested $574 million in ServiceNow stock.</p>
<p><strong>Nvidia</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NVDA' target='_blank'>NVDA</a>) is also among top stocks to watch. After going through a steep correction that began in October 2018, the chip designer and leading <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/technology/ai-news-artificial-intelligence-trends-and-leading-stocks/">AI stock</a> is now testing a new all-time high. Nvidia is also on the latest list of new buys by the best funds, with 37 institutional investors picking up $875 million in shares.</p>
<p>So as the rebound from the coronavirus stock market crash tries to gather steam, keep a close eye on where the best mutual funds are placing their bets. And be sure to stay focused on the <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investing-in-stocks-see-how-to-buy-stocks-investing-for-beginners/">"three big rocks" of CAN SLIM investing</a> to help ensure that you're placing your own bets on the top prospects.</p>
